label: CHANGE PROPOSED IN THE HONOR CODE

resource.chars:
CHANGE PROPOSED
IN THE HONOR CODE

STUDENT COUNCIL TO ACT
AFTER MOING OVER
SUGGESTIONS
Numerous recommendations have
been made for the revised Honor
code. Students and faculty are re-
quested to look over these suggested
changes and to voice further opin-
ions. The student executive council
intends drawing up a final code
alter considering all recommenda-
tions.
The code will be presented to the
Students’ Assembly and voted on by
written ballot.
Following are the recommenda-
tions thus far receiveed:
1. Honor systems are not preval-
ent In preparatory schools. For
this reason it would be fairer, in
the case of new students, in any
event Freshmen, not to impose the
maximum penalty for the first vio-
lation.
2. The penalty of any other viola-
tion of the Honor System shall be
handled by the Executive Commit-
tee, with a maximum penalty of
recommendation to the president
for dismissal from the University.
3. During examinations and quiz-
zes, where space permits, students
to be seated one seat apart.
4. Define examination—“A writ-
ten quizz for the duration of one
hour or more shall be considered
an examination.’’
5. Instructors are expected to re-
main in the room during examina-
tions.
6. Every faculty member and stu-
dent of the University is honor
bound to report any infringement
of the Honor System to the Honor
Court President and to the Presi-
dent of (he Student Assembly, in
the case of any violation of the
Honor Code which does not pertain
to examinations and quizzes.
7. Every faculty member and
student of the University is honor
bound to report any infringement
of the Honor System to the Honor
Court President, as pertains to ex-
aminations and quizzes, and to the
President of the Student. Assembly
all other cases coming within the
application of the code.
8. The Honor Court must take ac-
tion on any case t ithin two weeks
after it has been reported.
Officers and Duties
9. The Honor Court shall consist
of two undergraduates of each col-
lege, one Senior and one Junior
member, except immediately after
the May election, at which time the
court members will be Junior and
Sophomores. The new member
shall be elected by all members of
the college at a meeting during the
second week of May, said member
to be picked from the Sophomore
class. This meeting shall be called
by the Senior Class President of the
University, who will preside.
10. Annual ratification of the
Honor Code, subject to two-thirds
\ote of the student body, (This
would bring the system periodically
to the attention of all students and
would permit each student to have
a voice in its adoption.)
U. of M.
